course_metadata.name: Active Inference for Generative AI: Principles and Applications

modules.module_description: Introduce Active Inference as a unifying framework for adaptive systems, focusing on variational free energy minimization, predictive coding, and Bayesian inference.

learning_objectives: Understand the core principles of Active Inference
Describe how Active Inference explains adaptive behavior
Identify the role of perception and action in generating models of the world
sessions.rationale: Establishes the foundational theoretical framework for the course.

modules.module_description: Explore the application of Active Inference to contemporary generative models like LLMs and diffusion models, emphasizing precision weighting and exploration-exploitation.

sessions.session_title: Active Inference and Large Language Models
subtopics: RLHF as an Active Inference Process
learning_objectives: Explain how attention mimics predictive coding
Understand the role of precision weighting in LLM training
Relate RLHF to active inference processes
sessions.rationale: Connects theoretical principles to practical applications in LLMs.

modules.module_description: Examine more sophisticated applications of Active Inference, including multi-agent coordination, spatial intelligence, and embodied AI, highlighting challenges and opportunities for future research.

subtopics: Free Energy Minimization in Multi-Agent Systems
learning_objectives: Describe how multiple agents can minimize free energy collectively
Understand how Active Inference can guide embodied AI
Identify potential applications in autonomous systems and human-AI collaboration
sessions.rationale: Addresses advanced applications and future research directions.
